# Surge, amica mea

Surge, amica mea, speciosa mea, et veni.
Columba mea, in foraminibus petrae,
in caverna maceriae, ostende mihi
faciem tuam, sonet vox tua in auribus meis:
vox enim tua dulcis, et facies tua decora.
 Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
O my dove, who is in the clefts of the rock,
in the secret places of the stairs, let me see
your face, let me hear your voice;
for sweet is your voice, and your face is comely.
